title: Seelisberg becomes a place of international dialogue
subtitle: The Seelisberg Conference (context)
description: Seelisberg hosted the 1947 conference against antisemitism—part of the village’s wider history as a meeting place in the heart of Switzerland.

title: International headquarters established in Seelisberg
subtitle: A converted hotel becomes a hub (1968–1992)
description: According to public sources, a converted hotel in Seelisberg served as the global headquarters of Maharishi’s Transcendental Meditation movement from 1968 to 1992. (Please verify dates against your internal records.)

title: Sonnenberg site becomes part of the Movement’s infrastructure
subtitle: Hotel Sonnenberg area acquired (reported since 1972)
description: Swiss media reports that the former Hotel Sonnenberg site in Seelisberg has been owned by the TM movement since 1972 and was used as a yoga & meditation center.

title: MERU activity in Seelisberg expands
subtitle: Local teaching & cultural events
description: Local TM information pages describe ongoing teaching and event activity connected to MERU (Maharishi European Research University) in Seelisberg, including teacher training support and Gandharva Veda concerts.

title: Maharishi Ayurveda Health Centre operates in Seelisberg
subtitle: Well-being services in the village (since 1987)
description: The Maharishi Ayurveda Health Centre’s own site states it welcomed guests in Seelisberg since 1987 (later closure notice in 2025).

title: Headquarters chapter concludes (reported)
subtitle: Transition to other international hubs
description: Public sources report the Seelisberg headquarters period ended in 1992. Add your verified details on what changed operationally and where activities moved next.

title: Sonnenberg story revisited in Swiss media
subtitle: “Where the yogis learned to fly”
description: SRF published a feature on the Sonnenberg complex and its association with the TM movement in Seelisberg.

title: Ayurveda Health Centre closes (reported)
subtitle: Closure notice due to building sale
description: The centre’s own website notes that it closed in November 2025 due to the sale of the building, while consultations and services continued via other arrangements.
